headline: Best Spinach Dip Ever
description: This savory spinach dip is super creamy and served in a round sourdough bread bowl. It's easy to prepare yet impressive enough for entertaining!

video.description: Find out how to make creamy, delicious homemade spinach dip.
video.name: Best Spinach Dip Ever

name: Best Spinach Dip Ever
recipeIngredient: 0.5 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
1 (4 ounce) can water chestnuts, drained and chopped
1 (1.8 ounce) package dry leek soup mix

recipeInstructions.text: Mix sour cream, mayonnaise, spinach, water chestnuts, and dry leek soup together in a medium bowl. Chill in the refrigerator 6 hours, or overnight.
Slice off the top of the sourdough round and pull out the soft interior, leaving a sturdy bread bowl. Fill with spinach mixture. Tear removed bread chunks into pieces for dipping.

review.reviewBody: this is great but i have allergies to onions so i dont try to mess with things similar so instead of leek soup mix i throw in a little bit of beef Bouillon also i am currently in a place where i cannot get to water chestnuts and found that macadamia nuts work wonders. i will have to experiment with other nuts since macadamias are not the cheapest ingredient i just happened to have some of those on hand.

This recipe is ALMOST perfect. I made exactly as is and, after sampling, the spinach ratio is way off for my tastes. I ended up using almost 2 10oz bags (approx 18 oz) of frozen chopped spinach and 8 oz of water chestnuts (after adding all the extra spinach, I decided to use the rest of the can for balance). This resulted in rave reviews all night and folks actually cursing me for making dip so delicious they couldn't stop eating it. 4 stars as written, 5 stars after my alterations.
This is by far the best spenich dip. I make this every year for Holiday gatherings. And everyone loves it.
Great recipe. Easy. Delicious. A crowd pleaser! Used fresh spinach, chopped. Put it in a sourdough round. Added French bread for dipping.
I have made this dip since the 1980‚Äôs. The only difference is we used the entire box of spinach. Since it‚Äôs so good for the body, I don‚Äôt see why not using all the spinach. It‚Äôs a great dip!

Loved using the leek soup mix and am going to do it again this week. I have always used the Knorr Veg Soup mix so am delighted with the change. I also tried using frozen chopped kale instead of spinach and couldn't even tell the difference in flavor at all so I'll continue using kale. I added it in frozen and it worked great, I didn't notice any difference in the consistency of the dip at all either, which was surprising to me.
Made it as one of the appetizers for a group party we attended. The other guests all LOVED it!
I use to make this often for catering and holiday. Cannot eat spinach for health reasons. Think I will use canned artichokes. Please post any other substitute. No cauliflower.
Great recipe! I added real saut√©ed onions and just a little cream cheese it was wonderful! Thank you!
üòª I did change it though. I used Veganaise and two packets of vegetarian soup mix. Love it üòç

Love this recipe!! But when I went to make it I didn‚Äôt have the leek soup‚òπÔ∏è So chopped up one inch of fresh leek, one green onion, and 2 garlic cloves, plus 1 tbsp of powdered buttermilk. And I used 2 good handfuls of fresh spinach as I don‚Äôt like frozen. I like that hat I can make smaller batches as it is just my husband and myself and I wind up throwing a lot away. But over really good
I clicked on this recipe because I knew I had one that was the best. Surprise, this is the same recipe! And it is the absolute world best!!

Great. Those that already liked spinach dip, loved it and those that didn‚Äôt were converted. Even my picky, never-eats-appetizers sister-in-law couldn‚Äôt resist this with the jicama I cut with her in mind. Most really liked it with the bread or ritz so if you want to do super easy peasy, go that route. Tip: if this is a before dinner thing, serve early because it‚Äôs fairly substantial and guests may fill up on it ‚Äòcause it‚Äôs that tasty.

This is one of our all time favorite appetizer recipes. I do add 1 bunch of sliced green onions, and Knorr Leek soup is by far our favorite one to use. If I can't find it, I substitute their vegetable soup/dip.

I been making this spinach dip for years with out the water chestnuts but will try. 2things I add to mine is about a teaspoon to tablespoon spoon to taste of dill I put in my hand and rub it kind of fine don't do the seeds. And I add about the same of garlic powder depending on how much you like. It's best spinach dip ever. I also add green onions. Alot.
I always find it needs more spinach personally! Also if you can't find leek soup mix I often use vegetable and it's still very good! Overall this is a great recipe and always goes over well

Read comments that onion soup mix was too strong so I doubled everything and used I PKG of onion soup mix...it's perfect. I've never seen leek soup mix but we use onion soup mix with a 16 oz sour cream for dip all the time.

Really really good the only thing I have to have with spinach dip is Hawaiian sweet bread/ rolls. To me thats the key. A bowl and cut out the center if I'm making it for allot of people and just rolls sliced thin and lightly toasted when its just 1 or 2 people.
Very good
Wow this was terrible! All we could taste was the soup mix. I usually agree with the ratings on pretty much everything I've tried at AllRecipes, but this was way too bad to ever make again.
I love this dip, but had to make some modifications. I used entire box of spinach, an 8 ounce can of water chestnuts and 2 and 1/2 cups yogurt and 1/2 cup mayo. A little healthier, I think.
I have made this for sometime and the secret is the leek soup.

came out great! my tweaks: added 10oz of spinach, used half the mayo,and added half cup of cream cheese. I also didn't have the 6 hours so I could covered the soup mix with a few tablespoons of boiling water and covered. I really liked the leak soup vs veggie soup mix. Thank you OP
Excellent. Added 1 large minced green onion.

I have made this for years and always get requests to bring it with me for parties and holidays. I do make one change - I can NEVER find the dry leek package it calls for so I always use Knorr's Vegetable recipe mix and pick out the dried peas. It's a HIT and people love it so, so much.
Loved it! Added a diced habanero pepper to bring up the WoW Factor and that took it over the top. Great recipe.
Just not to my taste.
Every time I make this dip I‚Äôm always asked by multiple people for the recipe. It‚Äôs a keeper!

This very same recipe has been around for years! I've been making it for I don't know how long!! It's even better if you use a package of Knorr's Vegetable Soup Mix instead. Also, instead of using just mayonnaise try using Miracle Whip! As in 1/2 cup mayo and 1/2 cup Miracle Whip. Such a better flavour! I have never once thawed the spinach either. Chop it up still frozen and just mix it all in. Beyond perfect every time and is not the least bit watery! Actually, I thawed it out one time just to see what it was like, and it was 10x better frozen!
Great recipe - delicious. To those reviewers who said they "folllowed the recipe" yet used onion, not leek mix, and didn't like the taste - Duh!
Delicious!!! I made it as directed and it was a huge hit!!! Thank you for sharing your recipe! Easy and yummmmm!

This is just perfection. Made it for years and then for some reason kind of forgot about it. Started making it again recently and people just go nuts. I give the recipe to everyone. The Leek dry soup mix is a must. Don't expect the Onion or Vegetable mix to give you the same result. And yes, as others have said, use the whole box of spinach. Just make sure to drain it well.
This was easy and tasted amazing

Excellent flavor! I used saut√©ed fresh spinach and omitted the water chestnuts, as I forgot to buy them. I really liked using the leek soup mix as opposed to the vegetable or onion soup mix. This was fantastic as a veggie dip! The end result was like a thin dressing- I probably should have squeezed more liquid out of the spinach- so I blended in some cream cheese and that helped thicken it up some more. Really liked this - will make it again!
I used light mayo and added more spinach - its AWESOME!
Added 1 1/2 close of minced garlic. It was amazing!

I've made spinach dip with the vegetable soup and leek soup mixes. I really prefer the veggie soup. The leek soup mix made it taste far too much like onion dip. I also prefer my dip with more spinach.
I made this for Christmas it was not a big hit at all. It tasted very sweet and had an off flavor to it. I made it exactly as the recipe.

Great! I‚Äôve had this at other people‚Äôs homes and finally wanted to make it myself. I used the whole package of spinach and it was fine. Warning: Makes a LOT of dip. It filled a whole large mayo jar as well as a cereal bowl that I used to serve the first visitors on day one of Christmas entertaining. Yum!
Used whole box of spinach and larger can of water chestnuts. Turned out well!

I wasn't happy with this. I followed it every step exactly except for the bread bowl. 
Hardly anyone ate it. All you tasted was spinach and sour cream. It had no body of flavor. Very disappointed. I even kicked it up a notch with the left over I brought home. I dumped a ton of onion powder in it. That made it a little more flavorful.
Not a fan of the soup mix. Instead I used a ranch dip packet. Super yummy
Absolutely the best spinach dip recipe I have ever tasted. Don‚Äôt substitute the leek soup mix. Water chestnuts in the dip are wonderful.
Made this for a Christmas party Turned out great but I couldn‚Äôt find leek mix so I used knorr vegetable recipe mix. The entire bowl was gone and everyone was asking for the recipe.
Sooooo good, I just added a little more spinach and it was amazing.

I LOVE this recipe, restaurant style quality and my go-to for potlucks, bbqs and friend gatherings. I add a few diced canned artichokes for some amazing flavour and added creamy-ness. It's good as a cold dip or shred some cheese on top and bake it for a warm appetizer with toaster pita bread slices.

Except I use water chestnuts and NO leeks, I use green onion instead...didn't care for the leeky taste lol. I also add an 8oz pkg of softened cream cheese and bring EXTRA BREAD. This recipe w/the Liption (brand/generic) Onion Soup Mix is ALWAYS A WINNER. Several times SOMEONE asks to take the whole bread bowl w/left overs in it. TOP COMPLIMENT TO ME!!
I do not like mayonnaise so I use fat free greek yogut in place of mayo turns out great.
Wish I had read the reviews first. I love the taste but the texture not so much. Next time I will def add more spinach and water chestnuts or less mayo and sour cream to make it thicker.
I used the full package of spinach and epicure‚Äôs spinach dip seasoning instead of what is listed.
Too easy! Too good! I used low-fat sour cream and my husband loved it. Couldn't find leek soup so I used dry vegetable soup mix instead and it was really good
Made for 12 and used 3- bags frozen spinach- 10 oz, 1- 16 is natural sour cream, 2 cups ‚ÄúDukes‚Äù Mayo, garlic powder, 2 green onions and touch of Cayenne powder.
Delicious and super easy.
This was excellent .... best ever! I froze half and it‚Äôs was also wonderful a month later!
Very good..
Hands down BEST spinach dip I've ever had! I doubled the recipe for a big gathering & it was gone with in a few hours with everyone asking for the recipe.
No changes needed..just chill and serve...oh boy this is so great in the hot weather!!!
It is almost the best spinach dip ever.... After adding a splash of fresh lemon juice to the recipe. It adds a light and fresh note to the dip.

I always make this when I get chips on sale. Mine is basically like the original but with a little twist that I'm going to share with you. When it comes to sour cream and mayo keep the same and add some Greek plain yogurt to the mix and if you can find it.. dried spinach. And of course let it set will not be watered down. The yogurt gives more health and a zip to it. Your welcome.
Stringy and tasteless
I added about 3T of minced onions and some dashes of garlic.

I used the whole box of spinach. I forgot the water chestnuts. That‚Äôs the only change I made! The leek soup mix made thiiiissss! It was a huge hit!!! The leftovers were rightly stolen by others so I‚Äôll have to make it again for me :(. Lol
Nice one. Almost like what I made yesterday, Spinach Avocado Dip.

This recipe is very good. I added extra water chestnuts and the whole 10 ounce bag of spinach. Are used olive oil mayonnaise and about half of the package of leak soup mix. That still gave it plenty of flavor and it wasn‚Äôt overpowering. This is the second time I‚Äôve made it. The first time I followed the recipe exactly. I prefer it with a little less of the leak soup mix.

Really easy. Not much left when 5 people dug into it which is a sign it is really that good. I let it sit in the fridge for about 6 hours which seemed have blended the flavors just right. The toasted bread pieces from the sour dough round were disappointing but some crisp crackers saved the day.

I've made twice. 1st to the exact directions- it was pretty good- but not 5 stars. The second time I made these changes for Easter and my family devoured the entire thing in about an hour! - Use the entire bag of spinach. - Did not add water chestnuts. - Add 1 small tub of herb and garlic cream cheese (another reviewer's suggestion). -Add 1 cup of shredded parmesan. Did not put in sourdough bread. I am keeping this recipe forever. It actually made it to my physical recipe box!
Definitely will make again. I added onion soup ana dip mix. Mmmmm taste amazing. Its so quick to make so would be great for a last minute take along... Just an idea.
It was fine. Nothing to separate it from others I've tried, but it was definitely good and easy to make.

I made this in lieu of buying a spinach dip for an anniversary party we put on. I quadrupled this recipe and was able to not only fill a 12" bread bowl, but we refilled it two more times and I have a little left over. This was really easy to make and I followed the recipe exactly. I don't eat it so I don't know how it tasted, but like I said earlier, we filled the bread bowl a total of three times throughout the party.

Yep, this is the EXACT recipe we've all had at every church function growing up! I made it for a little gathering of friends along with another dip and this one was completely gone by the end (the other one not so much). Definitely a keeper! I used the entire box of spinach and Greek yogurt instead of sour cream.

love it! Instead of sour cream, i use nonfat cream cheese. It gives a richer flavor, but you don't have to wring out the water from the spinach, so its quicker. Definitely let sit overnight for better flavor.
Very delicious and so simple but you really should use the entire 10oz. Package of spinach if it's to truly be a Spinach Dip.

Love, Love, Love
This was very easy to make and I enjoyed every bite!
properly named.
I used Miracle Whip as I didn‚Äôt have mayonnaise and it was still great. We used sourdough bread to dip with and it was filling and yummy.
Very good as written. I made two batches, one as is and the second I added in a bunch of fresh minced garlic. Both went over well.

To get the flavor you want you MUST let the dip sit in the refrigerator, overnight is best. It will taste like onions if you mix and eat!!! It must marinate to get the best flavors. Also, squeeze all the water out of the spinach so it will not be so soupie. Adding a little extra spinach may help as well. 
This recipe is almost exact to knorr recipe, except it‚Äôs veggie mix instead of leek mix and knorr suggest green opinions. The taste is very similar, some prefer one over the other. However, you can not go wrong with either soup mix. 
I pretty much followed the recipe as written. 
I did add the green onion and pimentos. 
I also used an entire box of spinach. 
next time I will use a red bell pepper, a little garlic, more water chestnuts, and a box and a half of spinach for a little more texture. This was my first time making spinach dip and it was a hit. I served it with pita and tortilla chips..

I love this recipe. I've used it for years and always requested. I defrost the frozen spinach and wrap it with paper towels and wring the liquid out. I chop the chestnuts and throw it all together. There's never enough sour dough bread so I get 2 sour dough bagels and cut them down the middle into quarters. Then I cut each long piece with scissors. Much faster and every piece has some crust on it. Sour dough bread is the only bread to use. Just like the mayo, never salad dressing.
We have been making this recipe for years and it‚Äôs GREAT! The secret is the leek soup mix and it‚Äôs not always easy to find but worth the effort.
I make this dip. I add some lemon and a bit of Tabasco. Always a winner!
I added more spinach to it. I also used light olive oil mayo and fat free sour cream.
So easy and SO good! People raved! I couldn't find the leek soup so I used onion...same diff...
I did not make any changes to recipe. It was perfect and delicious! I made two batches and it was all eaten.
Hard not to enjoy something that's all cheese and sour cream. I did not see the leek soup mix at the store so I used garlic and it was still delicious. Will use leek next time if I ever find it.
I made it and my husband loved it. Thank you!
I made it, loved it and gave receive to others. An easy one to make adjustments, add to. Loved by all.
This is a great recipe but I do make some changes to make it my own. I cook then cool the spinach to bring out the taste and I substitute peeled chopped APPLES for the water chestnuts.
I made it with onion soup mix and no chestnuts. It‚Äôs a crowd pleaser!
My go too for pumpernickel bread dip and veggies. I use leek soup mix. Delicious!

I cannot use the leek soup mix or Knorr vegetable soup mix which I love as I they contain gluten. So I made a revision to this recipe. I chopped a small carrot into minced pieces and sauted in olive oil until soft. This equaled 1 Tbsp. As it cooled I added 1/2 tsp Mrs. Dash Tomato Basil Garlic, 1/4 tsp onion powder and 1/8 tsp salt. Next time I will add a tsp of minced sun dried tomato.
Was a big hit, I couldn‚Äôt find the leek soup mix so I used onion soup mix.....

The leek soup mix adds depth of flavor compared to the other soup mix traditionally used in spinach dip. This is my go-to appetizer now. Instead of mayo I substitute cream cheese and get really good feedback on the taste.

The tip to use a potato ricer to squeeze water from frozen spinach works like a charm!
I've made this a few times. Knorr vegetable soup mix works good too!
Substitue fresh spinach to make it AMAZING! Serve with a sliced baguette.
Tried and true and DELICIOUS
I omitted the water chestnuts, substituted Knorr Vegetable Soup Mix and some chopped red onion for the onion soup mix and reduced the sour cream (light) to 8 oz. Turned out beautifully!
My kids loved it...simple to make and nutrious!

I will definitely make it again. The hostess of the party that I made this for couldn't quit complimenting me on it - best spinach dip she ever had. There were about 6 teens there that devoured it. Easy and delicious. Made it just as described.

Mmmmmm...My store didn't have the Leek soup so I used the Vegetable Knorr Soup. It's only sat for about three hours, so I tried and it's delicious. It makes a bunch and is so yummy. Thanks! Oh, I added three green onions since I couldn't use the Leek Soup.
